intro: Diosma oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaved diosma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to regions of South America, particularly in the Andean foothills. The plant is characterized by its opposite arrangement of leaves, which gives it its scientific name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Diosma oppositifolia is often found in moist, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in temperate climates.
